reviewText: Most people seem to think this would be a fun party game for kids. Let me tell you about my experience. Obviously this is an anything goes" game
date: and we embraced this exactly how it was meant to be embraced.\n\nI'm with a group of 3 other people
recommended: all of whom are males about 16-19 years old. We have a small living room with an open space about 10 feet away from the computer/our buttons
hoursPlayed: and it's wide enough to give us ample room between each other. We have one keyboard and three xbox controllers all lined up in front of us on the computer's end of the living room. From left to right
voteText: I'm second in line.\n\nAs soon as our button pressing prompt appeared on the screen and we set off towards our controllers
helpfulPercent: I jumped on the person to my right and clung to him. (Un)fortunately
votesHelpful: this is that one friend who is 200 lbs of raw muscle
votesTotal: so while he may have been stunned for a brief moment when I hit him
votesFunny: he simply dragged me along the carpet until we got near our controllers. He started mashing the buttons on his controller
commentsCount: and I panicked -- I reached over and managed to wrestle the controller away from him
column16: and I then threw his controller across the room.\n\nI looked back at my controller to see the person on my left was mashing my buttons in an attempt to ♥♥♥♥ me up. The only thing I could manage to do from my current sideways position was use my legs to get him away from my controller
column17: which is exactly what I did: I kicked the ♥♥♥♥ out of him until he was forced to retreat to his own side of the room
column18: at which point I turned my attention to my own controller. Only problem was
column19: I didn't know how many times my button had been pressed
column20: so I pressed it a few times in an attempt to get lucky.\n\nI wasn't lucky. The winner of that round was the person on the very right
column21: who won simply because no one decided to pummel him and ruin his day."

reviewText: Unique indie game. Family friendly and quite fun. Definitely not for playing alone. Seems like a kind of 8-year-old's party game but its good for use as that nevertheless. I recommend buying on sale if you're going to buy at all, it's not worth much money.

reviewText:
Grab your buddies and a sixer of your favorite brew, and get ready to settle into some zany fun with B.U.T.T.O.N.

This cheeky little party game is perfect if you have a bunch of friends who like to get down on a board game from time to time. If you're going to be throwing a party with your friends, and they are even slightly interested in games, whether physical or computer based, I would highly recommend that you pick up B.U.T.T.O.N.

P.S.
If you drink alcohol while you play, don't break anything.

8/10 for original concept.

voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Perhaps the worst indie game I have ever had the misfortune to play, B.U.T.T.O.N. has only two positives going for it.  One, it works with the steam overlay, and two it seems stable and doesn't crash.  Beyond that B.U.T.T.O.N. can not really be enjoyed.  The game entirely consists of team competitions of pushing a button a certain number of times.  Not a mix of buttons mind you, but the space bar or A button on the controller only.  Needless to say, this isn't gameplay, it's a farce.  Avoid this title, as I assure you that most players would not enjoy this even if it was given away.

reviewText: This game really stands up to it's name Button"
date: It really is just a button smashing game that is enjoyed with friends or a group of people. You can use a keyboard. I prefer when playing with other people to play with Xbox 360 Controllers since they are alot easier to play with and you dont have to worry so much about braking them. The game is very simple
recommended: you read what is on the screen and do it accordingly then you get pushed to push the button that you are assigned to multiple times or not at all. It can be rewarding and frustrating to play with friends who cheat and try to throw off your character by pushing your button. The game is good but can get old really fast when it says the same thing in a different way a couple times. I recommend this game to people that have friends or want to do something different with their better halves. Its simple and fun
hoursPlayed: but frustratingly maddening all at the same time."
